title: 111_hr3639
content: The Act titled "Expedited CARD Reform for Consumers Act of 2009" allows for earlier effective dates for credit card provisions of the Credit Card Act of 2009. The Credit Card Act of 2009 is amended to specify the effective dates for certain credit card provisions, with exceptions for credit card issuers that are depository institutions. The Credit Card Act of 2009 is amended to specify effective dates for certain credit card provisions, with exceptions for depository institutions with fewer than 2,000,000 credit cards in circulation. The Credit Card Act of 2009 is amended to establish earlier effective dates for specific provisions to prevent further abuses, with exceptions for smaller depository institutions. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to expedite the effective dates of consumer interest rate increases, with exceptions for smaller depository institutions. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to expedite effective dates of consumer interest rate increases, with exceptions for smaller depository institutions. Penalty fees must be reasonable and proportional to the violation. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to expedite effective dates of consumer interest rate increases, with exceptions for smaller depository institutions. Effective dates for penalty fees must be reasonable and proportional to the violation. The Expedited CARD Reform for Consumers Act of 2009 sets the effective date for credit card changes to August 22, 2010. SEC. 4 clarifies that reductions in interest rates and fees can be implemented immediately without a 45-day delay. SEC. 5 imposes a moratorium on increases in rates, fees, and changes in terms detrimental to consumers. The Truth in Lending Act prohibits creditors from increasing rates or changing terms detrimental to consumers until February 22, 2010, for existing credit card accounts. The Truth in Lending Act prohibits creditors from changing terms or increasing rates for existing credit card accounts, except as provided in section 171(c) of the Act. SEC. 6. ADDITIONAL LIMITATIONS ESTABLISHED. Amends the Truth in Lending Act to allow consumers to cancel a credit card account without negative credit impact if they pay off the balance within 45 days of receiving notice of a new fee. SEC. 7. MORATORIUM ON RATE INCREASES. During a specified period after the enactment of the Credit Card Accountability Responsibility and Disclosure Act of 2009, creditors are prohibited from increasing rates, fees, or finance charges on credit card accounts. Additionally, they cannot alter the repayment terms for outstanding balances during this time. The terms "annual percentage rate," "finance charge," and "outstanding balance" are defined in accordance with the Truth in Lending Act. Any other terms not defined in this section will have the same meanings as in the Truth in Lending Act. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve has regulatory authority. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System has regulatory authority to prescribe necessary regulations for this section, effective upon enactment regardless of rule issuance. The House of Representatives passed the legislation on November 4, 2009.
